alert.note: Alert for Adams; Brown; Clermont (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 18 at 9:14PM EDT until July 19 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Adams County in southwestern Ohio... Southern Brown County in southwestern Ohio... Southeastern Clermont County in southwestern Ohio... * Until 1215 AM EDT. * At 914 PM EDT, An observer reported two inches of rain in under an hour near Georgetown. Radar estimates that between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Georgetown, West Union, Bethel, Felicity, Higginsport, Decatur, Russellville, Hamersville, Feesburg, Redoak, Point Isabel, Saltair, Nicholsville and Lindale. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. To report flash flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
